oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Woodland Theater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Frontview of the Woodland Theater in Nashville, TN.

Nickelodeons were the first type of indoor theaters for prpjected motion pictures. Popular in the early 1900s and 1910s, nickelodeons were usually small, simple theaters, usually set up in converted storefronts. Movie-goers could get admission to the theaters for five cents. Nickelodeons are synonymous with the emergence of American cinema.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Movie theaters
